text: <@UAYBXDG4U> <@U04DLJH3W94> please if you have any clue :slightly_smiling_face:
Hey! Are we still recommended to use the import solution with `js_partial` for CSS? The CSS is not getting minified, how can we solve that?

Hello,

This is information we need to bootstrap any React code we have on the client side so all the APIs, such as Islands, work properly and we can provide more functionality

Hi <@U04DLJH3W94> :slightly_smiling_face: Okay I was wondering if it could make the pagespeed code lower? Do you know if there is any impact? Also we planned to use this way of coding themes for customers, is it safe to display portalIds and stuff inside the code?

Our CMS has long shown the hubid/portalid in the page source (`hsVars` , some asset URLS, etc). I admit it is kind of messy, but nothing new/different/or problematic here (in my humble opinion).

The only real concern I know of inline scripts in general is that they are ‚Äúrender blocking‚Äù and there can be issues with interleaving inline scripts between stylesheets‚Ä¶ but I believe that isn‚Äôt a significant issue here with the inline script being so small and doing nothing except a few global sets (and that they are not in the head and put before the actual module html).

Hi <@UCY83QS6Q> :slightly_smiling_face: No problem I was just checking if everything is okay. For example on this page I used 8 rich text and 2 logos modules generated with React: <https://25969523.hs-sites-eu1.com/>

For each module I got a script generated, is it normal or do I miss something?

We‚Äôre hitting a remote API to validate the module (the same logic that would be running during the build) and trying to pass trough the specific error messages from that.  I think we‚Äôd need to look more at the specific module fields to see where specifically we can make this better

There are two things going on here. One is Vite dev-only behavior that has the inline style and linked stylesheet. That is not present when deployed to prod. (I‚Äôd like to check in what we can do to make this less different, but I‚Äôm yet sure if there is much we can do).

The second thing that does lead to some duplicated CSS in prod (but in a different way) is that `todo.module.css` is imported from both `Button.jsx` and `TodoList.jsx`. And that creates two separate duplicate CSS files (one named after button and one named after todolist). That can be worked around by refactoring `todo.module.css` into two separate files, but really you should not have to worry about that. I believe we can fix that, I‚Äôll put that on our list.

The CSS should be minified when deployed. Though I see that is not always the case. Hmm‚Ä¶

For example
<https://qa-pages.timmfin.net/hubfs/build_assets/hello-world-project/124/js_client_assets/assets/Layout-d908af6d.css>
<https://qa-pages.timmfin.net/hubfs/build_assets/hello-world-project/124/js_client_assets/assets/TodoList-be8b702a.css>
This is the best place for now. And to double check, this is specifically <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1708965639089149?thread_ts=1708960465.396299&cid=C04AY1H2204> ?

It is normal in terms that it is ‚Äúknown‚Äù, but yeah it is excessive for us to write out `window.__hsEnvConfig` , `window.__hsServerPageUrl` , and `window.__hsBasePath` for every island. Its on the list to improve, but behind other more impactful things. Thanks for the reminder.
Don‚Äôt think the encoding is the problem. For example `<https://registry.npmjs.org/@HubSpot%2Fcms-dev-server>` works fine
Thanks for the details :slightly_smiling_face:

And I don‚Äôt think we can do any more debugging on our side for a private package that isn‚Äôt found.

I‚Äôd recommend trying to do some debugging with npm locally to see if you can find that specific package version. Like via `npm info <package>` and `npm view <package> versions`

Note, we have a fix for CSS not being minified when deployed in progress. Looks like it was something that used to work but we accidentally broke it at some point. I‚Äôll respond back here when it is ready, though I‚Äôll be rolling this out incrementally (and need specific hub ids from folx who want the change enabled for new builds‚Ä¶ before we turn it on for everyone)

Pulling out conversation from ^ into a separate thread. We have deployed fixes that ensures CSS assets are minified (and also fixes the duplication issue <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1709132681963779?thread_ts=1709030342.141349&cid=C04AY1H2204|mentioned here>), but at the moment they are ‚Äúgated‚Äù and that fix is not on by default.

Please reach out to me (DMs are fine if preferred) with your hub/portal IDs if you would like to enable that. ( I assume we can quickly roll it out to everyone quickly, but would like to triple-check things first).

FYI, <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1709142408658869> ‚Ä¶ I believe we‚Äôve fixed the prod duplication (i.e. no need to refactor `todo.module.css` as I mentioned ^). If you‚Äôd like, could you share me the hub id you‚Äôre using so I can turn the fix on for you?
I'm having an issue where the hublData loads incorrectly on the live page but works just fine on preview mode, anyone else experiencing this?

Can you provide a live page link?

And hubl data template you are trying to use?
can't find where we discussed this but...I can pass an id and class prop to an island right? was it called something like `idWrapper`?
<https://www.npmjs.com/package/@HubSpot/cms-components?activeTab=code> `id`, `wrapperClassName`, `wrapperStyle`
<@UCY83QS6Q> adding an `id="whatever"` to my Island component did not work
the island has an id, but it is not the id that I set
```<div data-hs-island="true" id="island-5f5e32i1R0">```
~^ looks like this did in fact work but broke the site~ it did work but I made a mistake in naming it the same as an existing id on the body
the `npm install` process that happens during the upload is no longer picking up the `.npmrc`. i was able to install the package locally with no issues with `npm install` and a `.npmrc`

<@UAYBXDG4U> <@UCY83QS6Q> Wondering if this thread is same issue we are having. This is within the timeframe that it stopped working for us too.

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1708108558041179>
i was able to see the package information using the commands above as well

re-posting in the channel for more visibility - we are having issues installing a private package during the HubSpot build process. we were using an `.npmrc` that was injected using a secret but that is no longer working. curious if there was a breaking change that was released recently - this is crucial for our build. thanks for your help! cc: <@U066BM0FLH0> <@UAYBXDG4U> <@UCY83QS6Q>
also, `hs secrets list` no longer returns a list of secrets
Are you still able to add any secrets?
i'm not able to do much with `hs` right now, a lot is returning nothing back. i'm going to try to uninstall and reinstall and see if it fixes things
`hs init` and `hs secrets add` both did not return anything
i was able to upload a theme though
Ok, hm. Reinstalling is a good thing to try. And see if you can figure out the version it is (`hs --version`)
the version was `2.0.1`
I know our cli team had several issues relating to platform version and old (4.x.x?) version‚Ä¶ yeah, definitely update. The latest is 5.x.x

That‚Äôs a good start. But I figure you still have builds _not_ doing what you expect with the npmrc (and correctly getting access to private packages?)

‚Ä¶ unless there was a specific change you needed to make to that npmrc secret to get things to work again? (and now you can?)

just troubleshooting
